title: TARI Bean Program Workshop: GxE Analysis in R
description: Day x of the TARI Bean Program Training hosted by CIAT Arusha.
contents:
Welcome
My name is Ellena Girma and I am a data analyst intern at CIAT Arusha. I will be leading today’s workshop on GxE Interaction and Stability Analysis.
The goal of this workshop is to give TARI Bean Project scientists and technicians an overview of how to use R to run GxE Interaction and Stability Analysis.






fitvids('.shareagain', {players: 'iframe'});

Materials
R
You will need to install R as well as the following packages:



Data
Feel free to use your own data if you have data available. If you need data to practice on, I suggest using data from this paper. 1 The data contains information about the seed yield, 100 seed weight, number of seeds/pod, number of pods/plant and days to 75% flowering for 99 common bean variants grown in 3 locations. The data is listed under Appendix A. Supplementary data.
Slides (pdf format?)

‘’Philipo M, Ndakidemi PA, Mbega ER. Environmentally stable common bean genotypes for production in different agro-ecological zones of Tanzania. Heliyon. 2021 Jan 19;7(1):e05973. doi: 10.1016/j.heliyon.2021.e05973’’↩︎

title: GxE Past Paper Summary & Analysis
description: A summary & analysis of a past paper on GxE Interaction and Stability in Three Agro-ecologies in Tanzania presented this to Dr. Teshale and fellow colleagues Leah, Ombeni, and Anne. .
contents:
Workshop 1
To learn more about GxE Interaction analysis, I picked a paper and did a summary presentation. I chose  Environmentally stable common bean genotypes for production in different agro-ecological zones of Tanzania  as it would give me a good understanding of common bean production and productivity in Tanzania.
Here is the  slide deck  I made for the presentation. I presented this to Dr. Teshale and fellow colleagues Leah, Ombeni, and Anne.
